intro: Erigeron politus, commonly known as the smooth blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silvery-green, finely hairy leaves and produces blue to purple flower heads that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Erigeron politus is often found in the eastern and central United States.
